item.title: Case wont work
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“lov3_rs_money, post:12, topic:188950”][quote author=LeScape link=topic=251781.msg2107367#msg2107367 date=1205460353]
Which is why I said:

Make sure it’s under the correct switch.

Which in this case would be:

switch(objectID)

Lol, I just realised I said “which in this case would be”, when we’re talking about cases. Yaay irony.

Also, lov3, no you don’t, nothing happens if there is no else.
[/quote]
yh i just found that out :P, btw, maybe get rid of the Space,
so its like this?

case 10284:
if(actionTimer == 0) {	
sendMessage("You barely make it out alive!");	
teleportToX = 3494; 
teleportToY = 3483;
actionTimer = 7;
updateRequired = true; 
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
}
break;

i think that, that may work? thats the only thing that MIGHT be wrong with it.
hope it helps.
~lov3_rs_money[/quote]
Having a space where he had it is fine. If it was a code syntax error, an error would of been thrown upon compilation. It didn’t, hence there was nothing wrong with the syntax.

You do not need an else statement if you have an if statement. E.g
if(1 == 2) { // if 1 is equivalent to 2.
doSomething();
}

If 1 is equivalent to 2, which it is not, it will in this case, invoke doSomething(). But since 1 is not equivalent to 2, it will return.

Read full topic

case 10284:

item.title: Case wont work
item.dc:creator: @LeScape LeScape
item.description:
@LeScape wrote:

Which is why I said:

Make sure it's under the correct switch.
Which in this case would be: [code] switch(objectID) [/code] Lol, I just realised I said "[i]which in this case would be[/i]", when we're talking about cases. Yaay irony. ;)

Also, lov3, no you don’t, nothing happens if there is no else.

Read full topic

case 10284:
if(actionTimer == 0) {	

sendMessage("You barely make it out alive!");	
teleportToX = 3494; 
teleportToY = 3483;
actionTimer = 7;
updateRequired = true; 
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
}
break;

the location is right under the dummy case.
[/quote]
i think that because you’ve put the

if(actionTimer == 0) {

you have to add a

else if {

or whatever it is, well i think you do.
hope it helps

~lov3_rs_money[/quote]
You do not need an else for every single if statement.
